decks.notes: The deck focuses on overwhelming the opponent with aggressive creatures while disrupting their game plan with cards like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Archon of Emeria. The deck also utilizes powerful spells like Collected Company to quickly deploy threats onto the battlefield. Additionally, it includes a mix of creatures with disruptive abilities and evasive threats to maintain pressure on the opponent. Overall, the deck aims to establish a strong board presence early on and continue to apply pressure throughout the game to secure a quick victory.

This deck focuses on creating a powerful combo using Greasefang and Parhelion II to overwhelm the opponent. The deck includes cards like Fleeting Spirit and Seasoned Hallowblade to support the combo, while also including removal spells like Fatal Push and Vanishing Verse to control the board. The mana base is optimized to consistently cast the combo pieces, with lands like Godless Shrine and Concealed Courtyard. Thoughtseize is included for disruption, while cards like Monument to Endurance provide additional value. Overall, the deck aims to quickly assemble its combo and dominate the game.

This Dimir Aggro deck focuses on aggressive creatures with evasion like flying and unblockable to quickly chip away at the opponent's life total. It also includes disruption in the form of hand disruption spells like Thoughtseize and removal spells like Fatal Push to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck aims to apply early pressure and maintain board control, while also having some versatility with cards like Brazen Borrower and Moon-Circuit Hacker to deal with various threats. Additionally, the deck includes utility lands like Mutavault and Gloomlake Verge to help fix mana and provide additional benefits.

The deck aims to quickly assemble the Lotus Field combo, generating a large amount of mana to cast powerful spells like Emergent Ultimatum and Omniscience. It utilizes cards like Arboreal Grazer and Vizier of Tumbling Sands to ramp up to Lotus Field, while also including Hidden Strings and Pore Over the Pages to dig for key combo pieces. The deck also has access to extra win conditions like Fae of Wishes and Lair of the Hydra. The key strategy is to efficiently generate mana through Lotus Field and overwhelm the opponent with powerful spells and card advantage.

This deck focuses on aggressive play with a combination of disruptive spells and efficiently-costed creatures. The key strategy is to control the opponent's hand with cards like Thoughtseize and Fatal Push while applying pressure with evasive creatures like Faerie Miscreant and Moon-Circuit Hacker. The deck also has a strong late-game threat in Kaito, Bane of Nightmares and uses lands like Watery Grave and Mutavault to ensure that it can consistently cast its spells. Overall, this deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while quickly closing out the game with aggressive creatures.

The main focus of this deck is to utilize the combo potential of Lotus Field alongside cards like Scapeshift and Crumbling Vestige to generate a massive amount of mana and bring out powerful threats like Terror of the Peaks. The deck also includes various support cards like The Wandering Minstrel and Lumra, Bellow of the Woods to help in finding key pieces of the combo. By efficiently ramping up mana and utilizing the unique abilities of Lotus Field, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with powerful plays and synergies.

This UR Aggro deck focuses on quickly deploying threats and burning down the opponent's life total. It utilizes cheap instants and sorceries to trigger prowess on cards like Cori-Steel Cutter and Stormchaser's Talent, while also allowing for card advantage with Treasure Cruise. The strategy is to maintain a high tempo by efficiently removing opposing threats and countering spells, while pressuring the opponent with evasive creatures like Vivi Ornitier and Brazen Borrower. The deck aims to close out games swiftly by continually applying pressure and disrupting the opponent's game plan.

The deck focuses on using control elements to outmaneuver and disrupt opponents while utilizing a companion to provide additional support. With a mix of counterspells, removal spells, and card advantage engines, the deck aims to slow down the opponent's game plan and eventually take over the game with powerful finishers like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and The Wandering Emperor. The mana base is carefully crafted to support the deck's color requirements while also including utility lands to further control the battlefield.

The deck focuses on controlling the opponent's board through a combination of counterspells, board wipes, and removal spells. It also utilizes cards like Narset, Parter of Veils to limit the opponent's card draw and Teferi, Hero of Dominaria for card advantage and board control. The inclusion of Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion allows for additional value by flickering permanents like Omen of the Sea and The Wandering Emperor. The deck also includes land destruction with Field of Ruin and a variety of dual lands to ensure consistent mana fixing.

The deck focuses on building a powerful board with Greasefang, Okiba Boss and Parhelion II while disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Thoughtseize and Fatal Push. It aims to control the field by utilizing cards like Guardian of New Benalia and Monument to Endurance, while also providing protection with Seasoned Hallowblade. The deck also includes some utility lands and removal spells to keep the opponent in check. Overall, the deck aims to create a synergistic combo that overwhelms the opponent and secures victory.

This Golgari Aggro deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's hand with cards like Thoughtseize and Duress, while also using efficient removal spells like Fatal Push and Go for the Throat to control the board. The deck then aims to close out the game quickly with powerful creatures like Sheoldred, the Apocalypse and Mosswood Dreadknight. Liliana of the Veil provides additional disruption and card advantage, while cards like Scrapshooter and Blade of the Oni offer additional damage and value. The deck's mana base is designed to support its aggressive game plan while also providing flexibility and consistency.

The key concept of this deck revolves around utilizing the combo potential of Greasefang and Parhelion II to create a strong board presence and overwhelm the opponent. The deck includes cards that provide protection, removal, and card advantage to support the combo. By carefully managing resources and timing, the deck aims to control the game early on and quickly establish dominance through its powerful combo pieces. The land base is also optimized to support the strategy by providing the necessary colors and mana consistency for the combo to be executed successfully.

The main idea behind this Boros Aggro deck is to quickly establish a strong board presence and apply pressure on the opponent. The deck utilizes efficient creatures like Novice Inspector, Knight-Errant of Eos, and Venerated Loxodon to quickly build a threatening board, while also using removal spells like Portable Hole and Gleeful Demolition to deal with opposing threats. With a mix of early aggression and disruptive elements, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and secure a quick victory through a combination of creature damage and strategic removal.

The main concept of this Gruul Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive strategy. By playing low-cost creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Soul-Scar Mage, and utilizing burn spells like Burst Lightning and Reckless Rage, the deck aims to quickly chip away at the opponent's life total. Cards like Kumano Faces Kakkazan and Cori-Steel Cutter provide additional power and resilience to the deck, while lands like Ramunap Ruins and Thornspire Verge ensure consistent mana production for the aggressive game plan. The deck's goal is to apply early pressure and close out the game before the opponent can stabilize.

This deck focuses on quickly assembling the Greasefang Parhelion combo with cards like Greasefang, Okiba Boss, Parhelion II, and Recommission. It utilizes a mixture of efficient removal spells like Fatal Push and Thoughtseize to control the board while protecting key combo pieces with Seasoned Hallowblade. The deck also includes mana-fixing lands and some utility lands like Geier Reach Sanitarium. Overall, the key strategy is to set up the combo as quickly as possible while disrupting the opponent's game plan with targeted removal and hand disruption.

This deck focuses on quickly filling up the graveyard with spells to bring back Arclight Phoenix for repeated damage. It includes a mix of cantrips, removal spells, and treasure generation to help fuel the graveyard and keep the pressure on the opponent. By efficiently cycling through the deck and utilizing the Phoenix's ability to return from the graveyard, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a steady stream of flyers and burn spells, ending the game before the opponent can stabilize.
